metadata.title: CVE-2018-7751 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
The svg_probe function in libavformat/img2dec.c in FFmpeg through 3.4.2allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (Infinite Loop) via acrafted XML file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-7751` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:4.0-1
libavcodec-extra - 7:4.0-1
libavcodec-extra58 - 7:4.0-1
libavcodec58 - 7:4.0-1
libavdevice58 - 7:4.0-1
libavfilter-extra - 7:4.0-1
libavfilter-extra7 - 7:4.0-1
libavfilter7 - 7:4.0-1
libavformat-extra - 7:4.0-1
libavformat-extra58 - 7:4.0-1
libavformat58 - 7:4.0-1
libavutil56 - 7:4.0-1
libpostproc55 - 7:4.0-1
libswresample3 - 7:4.0-1
libswscale5 - 7:4.0-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:4.0-1').
mythtv package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
vice package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
gst-libav1.0 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
